2 System Setup 2.1 Quick start If you can’t be bothered reading simply do this: click here open the file and click install open RStudio copy & paste the following lines to the command line: install.packages("devtools") For a bit more info keep reading… 2.2 Bio-Linux Setting up your system with is often one of the most time consuming and frustrating parts of starting out in bioinformatics. To avoid the hassle we’ll be running Bio-Linux from a USB stick. This provides you with a Linux workstation pre-setup with many common bioinformatic tools. 2.3 R In addition to command line programs we’ll be using R to plot figures. R is a statistical programming language commonly used for down-stream statistical analysis and visualisation. R can be run from the command line, or using the popular user-interface RStudio. 2.3.1 RStudio We’ll be using RStudio for the course, which isn’t pre-installed on Bio-Linux - so simply click here to download for the Bio-Linux system, open the file and install. 2.3.2 R packages R packages devtools install.packages("devtools") BiocInstaller source('https://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R') biocLite('BiocInstaller') DESeq2 source("https://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R") biocLite("DESeq2")
